title: Senior Project Manager
content:
The opportunity
We’re looking to hire a versatile Senior Project Manager to help execute and manage the production of various creative projects from kick-off to launch. Projects consist primarily of digital out of home, video, and social assets using specific templates, with some occasional reporting and presentations. You will serve as the main point of contact with our US-based team, and be responsible for managing and regularly updating project status and key details, while keeping things moving with the local teams. Regular client communication is also necessary.
This role requires excellent communication and organizational skills, extreme attention to detail, a sense of urgency when responding to queries and while problem solving, as well as experience in managing projects, video production, and/or producing digital content in an advertising agency or equivalent. An intimate understanding of what is needed to run a successful project from start to finish is key. The goal of your team is to be nimble and reactive while producing a high volume of output following an established process each week. This role is based in Buenos Aires
Role & Responsibilities:

Serve as the primary point of contact for clients and project execution teams. You will be the main point of contact with our US-based team and also guide the creative team to deliver high-quality work on time each week. 
Collaborate closely with account and creative teams to oversee creative production for a high volume of templated digital projects and campaigns each week (weekly digital out of home campaigns for new music releases and follow an established process)
Manage all project-related details and communications from start to finish. Be in charge of asset management, share feedback, and respond to requests and project updates in a timely manner.
Manage day-to-day communications with the account, creative, and client marketing teams via email, chat, and video conference calls.
Create, update, and maintain project timelines and other related documentation, and provide regular project updates to clients and team members.
Build and maintain key relationships with client teams and internal discipline leads.
May occasionally liaise with regional teams on scaled global campaigns, help run projects requiring localization of creative assets, and help traffic final assets.

Requirements: 

3-5 years of experience working as a digital project manager or video/content producer in an advertising agency or video production house.
Knowledge of the creative process, or willingness to learn quickly. Ability to create and enforce project timelines.
You know how to communicate effectively with account leads, creative teams, as well as directly with clients. This includes providing project status updates, giving feedback, and negotiating.
Superb planning, organizational, and communication skills (written and verbal) with extreme attention to detail. 
Team player who can successfully work across teams, time zones, and technologies.
Familiarity with Google Suite and Wrike or other project management tools.
Able to work independently with minimal supervision, ask questions and flag potential issues as they arise, mitigate risk, and offer creative solutions to problems. 
Proficient english. This will be evaluated during the selection process.
About Media.Monks:
Media.Monks is the purely digital operating brand of S4Capital plc that connects 8,600+ digital natives across one global team. We are united by a mission to shift industries forward and pave the path towards ambitious outcomes so our clients and our people can realize their full potential for growth. Our unified model combines solutions in media, data, social, platforms, studio, experience, brand and technology services to help our clients continuously reinvent themselves throughout increasingly rapid cycles of disruption. Our efforts to shape culture, build innovative technologies and unlock the future of growth have earned recognition from numerous esteemed panels: we maintain a constant presence on Adweek’s Fastest Growing lists (2019-22), regular recognition at Cannes Lions, inclusion in AdExchanger’s Programmatic Power Players (2020-23), the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-23), a record number of FWAs, and have earned a spot on Newsweek’s Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023. Together, these achievements solidify our experience in digital innovation, excellence in craft, and commitment to personal growth.
While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Media.Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://media.monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.

Responsible that all your personnel apply information security in accordance with the established information security policy

We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a team that reflects the communities we serve. We welcome and encourage qualified applicants, from all backgrounds, who are excited to contribute to our mission. 

As a step in strengthening our hiring process, we invite you to voluntarily provide information that will help inform and improve our inclusion efforts.

As a reminder, answering this question is entirely voluntary. Your response will remain confidential and intended solely for the purpose of improving our hiring process; and will not, in any way, be associated with your specific application or be used in the hiring decision.
